title: Who am I
text:
I am Amir Salimi Babamiri, a PhD candidate at Cardiff Business School (Data Lab for Social Good). I am interested in sustainable supply chain management, striving to make both academic and practical contributions to the development of sustainable supply chains.
I am honored to be a recipient of the ESRC Wales Doctoral Training Partnership Studentship from UK Research and Innovation. The studentship is collaborative with Unseen UK.
My goal is to leverage cutting-edge research to foster sustainable and ethical supply chains. ## Education

title: Who am I
text:
Research focus / PhD project
My research focuses on understanding and modelling the impact of consumer purchasing behaviour on global supply chain decisions related to anti-slavery practices. My PhD research is aimed at:
1- Understanding and assessing consumer behaviour and attitudes towards products made by forced labour. 2- Developing a novel multi-level, multi-stakeholder approach to connect downstream and upstream supply chains, investigating the impact of consumer behaviour and attitudes on supply chain decisions about anti-slavery practices. 3- Creating innovative machine learning models to explain and predict consumer buying behaviour related to modern slavery, contributing to proactive actions by upstream supply chains.

title: Who am I
text:
Supervision team

Lead: Dr.Maryam Lotfi, Modern Slavery and Social Sustainability Research Group, Cardiff Business School, UK
Co: Prof.Bahman Rostami-Tabar, Cardiff Business School, UK
Co: Prof.Nicole Koenig-Lewis, School of Computer Science and Informatics, UK
Collaborator: Glenn Milano, Global Health Supply Chain, Bureau for Global Health, United States Agency for International Development (USAID)

title: Who am I
text:
Funder
Welsh Graduate School for the Social Sciences (WGSSS)

title: Who am I
text:
Teaching & training

Graduate tutor: Forecasting and Business Analytics modules (Cardiff).
Delivered workshops and short courses: Introduction to Python for researchers, time series forecasting workshops for pharmaceutical officers in Ethiopia, Quarto website training for R users.

title: Who am I
text:
Technical skills

Languages & tooling: R (tidyverse, tsibble, fable), Python (pandas, mlforecast), Quarto, Git/GitHub, Docker, LaTeX/TikZ
Forecasting & ML: State‑space models, Tobit/Kalman approaches, conformal prediction, LightGBM/XGBoost, probabilistic forecasting, hierarchical forecasting
Supply chain / domain tools: LMIS/DHIS2 contexts, inventory simulation, demand censoring and lost‑sales handling
Reproducibility & deployment: renv, Quarto websites, GitHub Actions, containerised evaluation (CHAP)

title: Amir Salimi Babamiri
text:
I am a PhD student at the Data Lab for Social Good research group at Cardiff University, UK. My research focuses on improving forecast methodologies for family planning supply chains in developing countries, with the goal of enhancing their efficiency and accessibility. In addition to my PhD work, I serve as the Coordinator and Training Lead at the Data Lab for Social Good.
I have also led the research network at Forecasting for Social Good (F4SG), an official section of the International Institute of Forecasters. As part of this role, I managed the Learning Labs workshop series, providing free training on forecasting methodologies using R and Python. I am passionate about leveraging data science and forecasting techniques to address global challenges, and I actively engage with the forecasting and social good communities through workshops, collaborations, and research initiatives.
Explore my full list of publications on Google Scholar.

title: Third Blog Post
text:
The source for any page in your website could also be a Jupyter Notebook. This one is third-post/index.ipynb.
Here’s an example I borrowed from the Seaborn docs:

import seaborn as sns

sns.set_theme(style="whitegrid")

# Load the diamonds dataset
diamonds = sns.load_dataset("diamonds")

# Plot the distribution of clarity ratings, conditional on carat
sns.displot(
    data=diamonds,
    x="carat", hue="cut",
    kind="kde", height=4, aspect=1.5,
    multiple="fill", clip=(0, None),
    palette="ch:rot=-.25,hue=1,light=.75",   
)
